meanings.definition: Refusing to compromise or change one's position
meanings.sent1: She was intransigently opposed to any alterations in the plan.
meanings.sent2: The team leader remained intransigently firm on the project deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat was intransigently determined to sit on the keyboard, no matter what.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood intransigently in the path of the new road construction.
meanings.sent5: His intransigently stubborn attitude made negotiation impossible.

meanings.definition: Stubbornly resistant to change or compromise
meanings.sent1: The child was intransigently against trying any new foods.
meanings.sent2: Despite the evidence, he remained intransigently convinced of his theory.
meanings.sent3: The intransigently closed door refused to budge no matter how hard they pushed.
meanings.sent4: Her intransigently locked phone kept her secrets safe.
meanings.sent5: The intransigently silent cat refused to meow no matter what.
